summary.p: Bound codex, containing folios of various measurements and paper. Handwritten notes by Édouard Ariel, that is, translations, mostly extracts rather than the full work, in French from the Tamil, Sanskrit, and Telugu.

There were originally various bundles, each contained in a folded folio bearing title and often a date (these folded folios also bear library foliation). For some texts, instead of translations, we find rather a list of vocabulary. Various notes are occasionally inserted between the folios of translation.

There are in total 19 bundles, each contained in folded folio, as follows:
Naḷaccakkiravarttikatai 1846 (f1-f6)
Ariccantiracarittiram 1846 (f7-f13)
Kapilar Akaval 1846 (f14-f18)
Tiruvātavūrar Purāṇam 1846 (f19-f22)
Kokkōkam 1846 (f23-27)
Vētaviḷakkam (f28-f33)
Ātticcūṭi 1846 (f34-f38)
Pañcatantiram 1846 (f39-f100)
Tiruviḷaiyāṭaṟpurāṇam 1847 (f101-f104)
Naṉṉēṟi 1847 (f105-f115)
Periyapurāṇam 1847 (f116-f120)
Prasannarāghavīryam 1848 (f121-f128)
Kōḷatīpikai 1851 (f129-f131)
Ñāṉavuṇarttutal 1851 (f132-f137)
Ñāṉacīvavātakaṭṭaḷai 1851 (f138-f147)
Oreḻupatu: Tirukkaivaḻakkam 1852 (f148-f151)
Various fragments (f152-f158) = Vālmīki Rāmāyaṇa acc. to Vinson (1867, p. 42).
Kāciyāttiraic Carittiram 1848, 1851 (f159-f192)
Ācāranidhi 1846, 1847, 1850 (f193-f292)

origin.origDate: The date of the translations indicated by Ariel range from 1846 to 1851. Various dates noted by Vinson (1868). Not dated by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Papers of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, Département des Manuscrits, Inventaire 7 = dons : manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, n° 1 à 3306: no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 28.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49). — See p. 41.
